title: Price fluctuations of cloves and causes of

content.description:
CLOVE* PRICES IN SOUTHEAST ASIA AND IN AMSTERDAM, 1580–1850

(in Spanish silver reals, a common trade currency in the East Indies)

*Cloves are spices native to the Moluccas islands in eastern Indonesia and, until the late eighteenth century, grown only in Southeast Asia.

Source: David Bulbeck, Anthony Reid, Lay Cheng Tan, and Yiqi Wu, eds. Southeast Asian Exports Since the 14th Century: Cloves, Pepper, Coffee, and Sugar, (Leiden, The Netherlands, KITLV Press), 1988. Graph 2.2., p. 57
content.question: For the period circa 1580–1650, which of the following most directly caused the price fluctuations shown in the chart?

choices.label: The replacement of traditional landed elites by new commercial elites in many parts of Eurasia
The declining military power and international influence of the Mughal Empire
The establishment of Caribbean plantation economies based on the production of cash crops by slave labor
The intensification of competition among European states over the control of profitable maritime trade routes

content.answer: The intensification of competition among European states over the control of profitable maritime trade routes

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
